channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: At top of Kingdon Road, NW6 1PH, by the side of the synagogue's community centre, 24th November
item.description:
Water now running down the roadway on the evens side; probably a burst pipe. Yesterday I reported the same problem occurring on the odds side (NW6 1PJ), so the problem has now extended. This has been occurring for over a week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingdon Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leafing/litter request, 24th November
item.description:
There are piles of leaves mixed with bits of plastic litter in all local streets,.I.e. York Hrove, Colls Road, Astbury Road and St Mary's Road. Conditions on pavements very slippery in wet conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dayton Grove, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Christchurch Ave, Mapesbury Rd and others, 24th November
item.description:
The trees have almost completely shed their leaves, and usually, by this date, the dead leaves have all been removed very efficiently - but not this year! There remain masses of dead foliage on the pavements. It’s a nuisance when it’s dry, but after rainfall, it can be very dangerous. I’m in my mid-70s, and walking isn’t quite as easy as before. The combination of a mass of dead leaves and rain is treacherous for me, other seniors, disabled people, etc. I’m terrified of slipping and hurting myself badly. Others must be similarly terrified. This applies to quite a few tree-lined streets in this area. Please arrange for the leaves to be removed as soon as possible. Thanks.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven dangerous pavement tiles, 24th November
item.description:

item.title: Tree stump, 24th November
item.description:
Early this year you decided to cut down the tree without any reason for being cut down any notification to residence you cut a tree down you left the stump in the ground. It’s actually quite dangerous and it is now being obscure by where the tree young new branches are growing from the stump that would’ve been nice if you’ve cut it down to remove it fill the whole tarmac and make it good and look neat and tidy because at the moment it is a bit of a trip hazard and it’s quite dangerous you leaving a tree stump without it being removed properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Floor carpeted with litter and glass outside primary school, 24th November
item.description:
The gutters, pavements and roads outside st Patrick’s primary school, Ancona road, are literally covered in litter. There are broken glass bottles of alcohol, empty beer cans and general litter all over the street and this has been slowly gathering for weeks despite it being reported. Please can a team come out to deal with this? The bulk of the glass is right outside the nursery where 3 and 4 year olds run around the school gates, it’s not safe.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Griffin Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp 2 not working, 24th November
item.description:
The lamp on the corner of West Street and Chandler Drive lamp number two the responsibility of Bexley Council is no longer working. The lightbulb has gone and it is very dark on that corner and because of the way the paving slabs are uneven which is again under the Bexley Council it could be a trip hazard and a legal lawsuit against the council for negligence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chandlers Drive, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
